Name: Amman
Description: Amman is the capital and largest city of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan (population c. 2.1 million). Amman forms a great base for exploring the country and does, despite popular belief, hold a few items of interest to the traveler. The city is generally well-appointed for the traveller, reasonably well-organized, and the people are very friendly.

Name: Aqaba
Description: Aqaba (العقبة al-ʿAqabah) is Jordan's only port city. It is on the Gulf of Aqaba in the extreme south of the country.

Name: Irbid
Description: Irbid is a city in northern Jordan, some 88 km north of the capital Amman.

Name: Jerash
Description: Jerash, a city in northern Jordan, is famous for its Roman ruins. The archaeological site is popular for tourists, second only to Petra.

Name: Kerak
Description: Kerak (also spelt Karak, Arabic al-Kerak) is a small, Arab city (population 170,000) in southern Jordan.

Name: Madaba
Description: Madaba [dead link] is a small town in central Jordan located south of the capital Amman on the King's Highway, some 10 km from Hesban.

Name: Salt
Description: Salt is an ancient town in Northern Jordan; it was once the capital of the territory.

Name: Zarqa
Description: Zarqa is a town in the Kingdom Of Jordan.

Name: Ajlun
Description: Ajlun, a city in Northern Jordan, is famous for its castle. The archaeological site is popular for tourists. The surrounding hills are cooler and have more trees than elsewhere in Jordan, making it a pleasant area to spend a day or two.

Name: Azraq
Description: Azraq ( الأزرق ) is a historic wetland in the Jordanian Eastern Desert.

Name: Dana Nature Reserve
Description: Dana Nature Reserve is in Jordan, 88 km south of Kerak.

Name: Dead Sea (Jordan)
Description: The Dead Sea (Hebrew: ים המלח, Hebrew transliteration:Yam HaMelach; Arabic: البحر الميت, Arabic transliteration: al-Bahir al-Mayyit) has its eastern coast in Jordan. It is the lowest point in the world at 394.6 m (1269 ft) below sea level.

Name: Desert Castles
Description: The Desert Castles of Jordan are in the kingdom's Eastern Desert.

Name: Petra
Description: Petra, the fabled "rose red city, half as old as time", is a well known ancient Nabataean city in the south of Jordan. Due to its breathtaking grandeur and fabulous ruins, Petra was recognized as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1985.

Name: Umm Qais
Description: Umm Qais is a Roman ruin in Northern Jordan.

Name: Wadi Rum
Description: Wadi Rum is a spectacularly scenic desert valley (wadi in Arabic) in southern Jordan. It is also known as "Valley of the Moon" and inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.
